III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107 Employment policies and procedures;
Section establishment
Description (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are concerns that youth are being verbally and mentally
abused by two staff members. The youth are being screamed and
cussed at when they get out of line a little bit. About three weeks
ago, a staff member told a youth they are worthless.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on May 29, 2025.
Complainant reported the youth expressed concerns about
Supervisor, Staff 1, and Staff 2. He reported Youth A reported
Staff 1 had told him he is a “worthless piece of shit.” Complainant
reported he did not hear this directly, but Youth A did report this
concern to him about three weeks ago. He reported he brought
this to the attention of Supervisor, and she stated Youth A is trying
to pin staff against one another. Complainant wrote a letter to
Administrator about these concerns but never heard back from
him. He reported he had heard Supervisor yell and swear at the
youth. When asked to provide an example, Complainant reported
he heard Supervisor tell the youth, “Do what I say now, damn
it.” He could not remember what youth was involved or when this
occurred. He reported he just wants to make sure the youth are
not verbally or mentally abused at the facility due to the way
Supervisor, Staff 1, and Staff 2 treat the youth. Complainant could
not remember the other names of the youth that was involved in
these situations or dates when he witnessed these concerns.
Administrator was interviewed via phone on June 3, 2025.
Administrator confirmed he received a letter that noted concerns
about the youth not needing to do chores and that some staff are
to hard on the youth. Administrator was not sure it the note
especially addressed a certain staff or not. He reported he did not
have time to follow up as it was just received prior to this
investigation. Administrator reported there were recently some
staff that were let go from the facility due to them not following the
required programming the youth needed to complete.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 3,
2025. Youth A reported things are going well at the facility. He
2

reported he did hear Staff 1 one time say a swear word, but it was
not towards him. Youth A denied Staff 1 ever calling him
worthless. He reported he does get frustrated with Staff 1 because
she is always making sure the chores are being completed at the
facility. He denied having any concerns with Staff 2 or Supervisor.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on June 3, 2025. Staff 1
reported she mainly works the weekday shifts at the facility. She
reported she has never seen any issues with Supervisor or Staff 2
swearing at the youth or treating them poorly. Staff 1 reported she
has never sworn at a youth. She denied ever telling Youth A he
was worthless. Staff 1 reported she does hold the youth
accountable which sometimes can upset the youth because they
do not want to do their chores. She reported there was one time
when she did swear when she dropped something, but it was on
accident and took responsibility for this. Staff 1 reported she would
never swear at a youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 3, 2025. Supervisor reported these reported concerns were
never brought to her. She reported at the staff meeting it was
discussed with all staff about the youth needing to follow through
with chores and some staff felt the youth should have more free
time to relax on the weekends. Supervisor confirmed some staff
were let go from the facility due to not following the staff
expectations and procedures of the home. Supervisor reported
she explained to staff that the youth need to be taught to keep
their space clean and follow through with assigned chores. She
denied ever telling the youth, “Do what I say now, damn it.”
Supervisor reported she has never yelled at the youth or sworn at
them. She reported she has never had the youth make any
complaints about Staff 1 or Staff 2. Supervisor reported she had
discussed with Staff 1 before, informally, that she cannot swear.
She reported this was because she overheard Staff 1 swear when
she dropped something, but it was not towards anyone.
Supervisor reported Staff 1 took responsibility and reported it was
an accident. She reported there have been no other concerns
since then.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 3,
2025. Staff 2 reported there have been some complaints made by
the weekend staff that the weekday staff are too hard on the youth
because the youth are held accountable for doing their chores
during the week. She reported she has never sworn or belittled a
youth at the facility. Staff 2 denied hearing Staff 1 or Supervisor
swear at the youth and has never heard a complaint from the
youth about this happening. She reported staff are trained at the
3

facility to treat youth with respect and have them follow the
expectations of the facility.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on June 3, 2025. Staff 3
reported things are going well at the facility. She reported she
works often with Staff 1 and does not have any concerns. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 did swear one time when she dropped something,
but Supervisor talked with her about it and there has been no
concern since then. She confirmed when Staff 1 swore it was not
towards youth and noted it was an accident. Staff 3 reported she
has no concerns about Staff 2 or Supervisor’s interactions with the
youth. She reported no youth has reported any concerns with her
about Staff 1, Staff 2, or Supervisor.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 3,
2025. Youth B reported she feels safe at the facility and does not
have any concerns with any of the staff. She denied staff ever
yelling at her or swearing. Youth B reported during the weekdays,
staff always make sure youth are doing the programming, and the
weekend staff do allow them to get away with not doing all the
chores.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 3,
2025. Youth C reported he has no concerns at the facility and
reported all the staff are kind. He reported he has never heard a
staff member swear or demand a youth to do something. Youth C
reported Supervisor, Staff 1, and Staff 2 are all nice and noted
they just hold the youth accountable for what they need to get
done to be successful in the program.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Policy- Staff Conduct- The policy notes states
staff are to not yell or scream at the youth, swear at the
youth, make threatening statements, bully or belittle the
youth.
- Staff 1 Human Resource File and Training Record- Staff
1 has no disciplinary actions noted within the HR file. Staff
1 is in compliance with all her training requirements and
signed the code of conduct on 10/30/2024.
- Supervisor Human Resource File and Training Record-
Supervisor has no disciplinary actions noted within the HR
file. Supervisor is in compliance with all her training
requirements and signed the code of conduct on
01/09/2025.
- Staff 2 Human Resource File and Training Record- Staff
2 has no disciplinary actions noted within the HR file. Staff
4

2 is in compliance with all her training requirements and
signed the code of conduct on 12/01/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Youth denied any concerns of
Supervisor, Staff 1 or Staff 2 screaming or yelling at them. Youth
A denied Staff 1 ever calling him worthless.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
